page.title: 19A RIDING SCHOOL
page.content: 3 Greys Riding School is situated in School Lane, Pyecombe. It was started in 1963 and consists of 12 stables on an 8O acre site. The school owns 6 horses, 14 ponies and 2 donkeys with 2O ponies at livery. All ponies have to be sensible and quiet. The ponies work no more than 5 hours per day although day treks last from 1O am to 4 pm with 1 hour break for lunch. Sunday is the busiest day. All treks are escorted and bridle paths on the Downs are used. The owner and 3 girls work at the stables. There are also 2 working pupils, 1 groom and 1 Assistant Instructor. The day begins at 7 am, 15 minutes is allowed to clean each stable. Riders are mostly local from Brighton, Burgess Hill, Hassocks and Haywards Heath. One comes regularly from London and one in summer from France.
